item.title: Weekly Rundown 5 (27 February_5 March)
item.description: What have I been up to? Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Fusce non commodo mi. Morbi tristique varius neque quis mollis. Nulla at pulvinar lacus, eu lacinia erat. Nam nec fringilla velit, vel volutpat libero. Sed dapibus erat id faucibus aliquam. Vestibulum porta pretium quam et faucibus. Nam tempus sed mi sed malesuada. Class aptent taciti sociosqu ad litora torquent per conubia nostra, per inceptos himenaeos. Nunc ut sapien id augue dignissim rutrum.

item.title: Weekly Rundown 4 (6 February_12 February)
item.description: Curated selection Intresting articles Snap is finally profitable Snapchat has more users than ever. Nearly five years after going public, Snap is finally profitable. The company shared the milestone in its fourth-quarter earnings release, where it reported $23 million in positive net income. https://www.engadget.com/snap-q4-2021-earnings-230605242.html Why gamers hate crypto, and music fans don’t The very different reactions that two different types of fandoms are having to blockchain-based products — and whether that tells us anything about what average people might actually want out of crypto.

item.title: Weekly Rundown 2 (21 November_27 November)
item.description: What have I been up to? This past month has been a lot of work. Having done tests on all my different classes and also many different team projects, I can say that November has been tough. Despite all I said, I think that this year has been the least stressful of my 3-year journey at university. I think I have adapted quite well to this lifestyle, and if I keep my pace, I think I’ll do fine.

item.title: Weekly Rundown 1 (24 October_30 October)
item.description: What have I been up to? I decided to start this new project where I write about all the cool stuff that happened each week. I will try to post one of these everyweek, starting now (last week of October 2021). To help achieve this, I created a python script that automaticly create a post with some template text. import datetime import calendar import os def getSundayDate(weekday, date): switcher = { "Monday": 1, "Tuesday": 2, "Wednesday": 3, "Thursday": 4, "Friday": 5, "Saturday": 6, "Sunday": 0 } difference = switcher.
